News.Title: AUV Innovations Acquires 2.42% Stake in Zee Media
News.Summary: AUV Innovations LLP acquired 1.51 crore shares of Zee Media Corporation for ₹89.38 crores through open market purchase, increasing its holding to 9.41% under SEBI disclosure regulations.

News.Title: Zee Media Faces ₹18.11 Cr Copyright Claim
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation faces pre-institution mediation proceedings over alleged copyright infringement with damages claimed at ₹18.11 crores plus 18% interest by opposing party.

News.Title: Zee Media Reports No Fund Utilization in Q2 FY26, Monitoring Agency Highlights Market Price Concerns
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation submitted its monitoring agency report for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, showing no fund utilization during the period. The company had raised Rs. 200 crore through preferential issue of fully convertible equity share warrants in October-November 2024. CARE Ratings Limited, the monitoring agency, reported that no funds were received in the quarter, hence utilization was nil. All proceeds received in Q3 FY25 pertaining to 25% upfront consideration have been utilized as per specified objects. The monitoring agency noted that current market price per equity share is lower than the warrant exercise price, which may affect the viability of objects. The report also highlighted that Zee Media has been incurring losses at PAT level for the past 3 years and Q1 FY26. The company received Rs. 50 crore in the quarter ended December 31, 2024, which has been fully utilized. The warrant conversion deadline is May 6, 2026.

News.Title: Zee Media Reports Rs 3,024 Lakh Loss for Half-Year Ended September 2025
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation Limited reported a net loss of Rs 3,024 lakhs for the half-year ended September 30, 2025, compared to Rs 5,772 lakhs loss in the same period last year. Revenue from operations increased to Rs 25,887 lakhs from Rs 22,044 lakhs year-over-year. The company's working capital remains negative. On a quarterly basis, the company posted a loss of Rs 2,362 lakhs for Q2 FY26 versus Rs 4,324 lakhs loss in Q2 FY25. Total expenses for the half-year were Rs 29,312 lakhs. The company has allotted 13.33 crore fully convertible warrants to three Foreign Portfolio Investors for Rs 5,000 lakhs and approved raising funds through Foreign Currency Convertible Bonds up to USD 46.59 million. The Board has prepared financial results on a going concern basis citing business plans to secure higher revenues and cost rationalization measures.

News.Title: Zee Media Corp Reports Narrowed Q2 Loss Despite Revenue Growth
News.Summary: Zee Media Corp reported a consolidated net loss of 155.3 million rupees in Q2, significantly reduced from the previous year's loss of 496.9 million rupees. The company's revenue increased to 1.79 billion rupees compared to 1.31 billion rupees in the same quarter last year, representing substantial year-over-year growth.

News.Title: Zee Media Corporation's Chief Revenue Officer Rajesh Sareen Resigns
News.Summary: Rajesh Sareen has resigned from his position as Chief Revenue Officer at Zee Media Corporation Limited, effective from the close of business hours on November 10, 2025. Sareen, who was part of the senior management personnel, cited personal reasons for his decision to leave the company. In his resignation letter, he expressed gratitude for the support and opportunities provided during his tenure and wished the company continued success.

News.Title: Zee Media Appoints Raktimanu Das as Chief Executive Officer
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation Limited announced the appointment of Mr. Raktimanu Das (popularly known as Mr. Raktim Das) as Chief Executive Officer, effective November 4, 2025. The appointment was approved by the Board of Directors based on the recommendation of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee. Das brings over two decades of media experience across various leadership roles at prominent Indian media companies including TV9 Network, Zee Entertainment Enterprises, Network18 Media Investments, India Today, and The Times of India. He has extensive experience in broadcast, digital, and OTT businesses, with expertise in revenue leadership, editorial functions, and monetization strategies. Das holds a Post Graduate Diploma in Media Management from Times School of Management and a Masters degree in Operational Research.

News.Title: Zee Media Appoints Manish Seth as Chief Revenue Officer
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation Limited has appointed Manish Seth as Chief Revenue Officer, effective October 28, 2025. The appointment was approved by the Board of Directors based on the Nomination and Remuneration Committee's recommendation. Seth brings over 25 years of experience in media sales, business strategy, and revenue leadership. He previously served as Revenue Head at TV9 Digital and Business Head at Money9, where he doubled the company's digital revenue in two years. Seth has also held senior leadership roles at Zee Unimedia Limited, Zee Media Corporation Limited, and Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd. He holds a Post Graduate Diploma in Marketing Management from Times School of Marketing and a bachelor's degree in science from Delhi University.

News.Title: Zee Media Reports Q3 FY25 Results, Appoints Senior Management Personnel and New Secretarial Auditor
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation Limited's Board approved unaudited financial results for Q3 and nine months ended December 31, 2024. The company reported a standalone loss after tax of Rs. 1,995 lakhs for Q3 FY25 compared to Rs. 3,818 lakhs loss in Q3 FY24. Revenue from operations increased to Rs. 11,696 lakhs in Q3 FY25 from Rs. 11,578 lakhs in Q3 FY24. For nine months, the company posted a loss of Rs. 7,767 lakhs versus Rs. 8,618 lakhs in the previous year. On a consolidated basis, Q3 loss was Rs. 2,242 lakhs compared to Rs. 3,591 lakhs in Q3 FY24. The Board appointed Harsh Mittal as Senior Manager - Finance & Accounts and Sandeep Jindal as Commercial Head under Senior Management Personnel category. M/s. Neelam Gupta & Associates was appointed as Secretarial Auditor for a five-year term starting April 1, 2025. The company had previously allotted 13.33 crore fully convertible warrants to Foreign Portfolio Investors in November 2024, raising Rs. 5,000 lakhs. The Board also approved raising additional funds up to Rs. 40,000 lakhs through various instruments, subject to shareholder approval.

News.Title: Zee Media Corporation Seeks Shareholder Approval for Director Re-appointments and Commission Payment
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation Limited has issued a postal ballot notice seeking shareholder approval for three key resolutions. The company proposes to re-appoint Susanta Kumar Panda as Independent Director for a second five-year term from September 1, 2025 to August 31, 2030. Additionally, it seeks approval for re-appointing Dinesh Kumar Garg as Whole-time Director (Executive Director - Finance) for three years from September 20, 2025 to September 19, 2028, with a basic salary of Rs. 375,117 per month and allowances up to Rs. 275,000 per month. The third resolution involves payment of commission to non-executive directors for three financial years starting from 2025-26. The e-voting period runs from August 1 to August 30, 2025. The company has been experiencing losses, with profit after tax of negative Rs. 1,003.46 lakhs in FY 2025 and declining revenues from Rs. 5,375.62 lakhs in FY 2023 to Rs. 4,635.14 lakhs in FY 2025.

News.Title: Zee Media Board Approves Re-appointment of Three Directors Subject to Shareholder Approval
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation Limited's Board of Directors approved the re-appointment of three directors during their meeting on July 29, 2025. Mr. Amitabh Kumar was re-appointed as Non-Executive Director, retiring by rotation at the upcoming 26th Annual General Meeting. Mr. Susanta Kumar Panda was re-appointed as Independent Director for a second term of 5 years from September 1, 2025, to August 31, 2030, as his first term expires on August 31, 2025. Mr. Dinesh Kumar Garg was re-appointed as Whole Time Director for three years from September 20, 2025, to September 19, 2028, as his term expires on September 19, 2025. All re-appointments were recommended by the Nomination and Remuneration Committee and are subject to shareholder approval. The Board also approved a Notice of Postal Ballot for seeking shareholder approval for the re-appointments and payment of commission to Non-Executive Directors for three financial years starting from 2025-26. All three directors have confirmed they are not debarred from holding director positions.

News.Title: Zee Media Corp Reports Improved Q1 Performance with Higher EBITDA and Reduced Losses
News.Summary: Zee Media Corp announced its Q1 financial results showing revenue of 1.82 billion rupees compared to 1.76 billion rupees in the same period last year. The company's EBITDA increased to 198 million rupees from 148 million rupees year-over-year, with EBITDA margin improving to 10.85% from 8.39%. The consolidated net loss narrowed to 88 million rupees compared to a loss of 104 million rupees in the previous year's corresponding quarter.

News.Title: Zee Media Corporation Schedules Board Meeting for Q1 FY2025-26 Results on July 29, 2025
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation Limited has scheduled a Board of Directors meeting on July 29, 2025 to consider and approve the Un-Audited Financial Results for the first quarter and three months period ended June 30, 2025 of Financial Year 2025-26. The results will be reviewed by the company's Statutory Auditors. The trading window for the company's equity shares remains closed and will continue until 48 hours after the declaration of results, extending till July 31, 2025. The trading window closure was implemented in accordance with insider trading regulations.

News.Title: Zee Media Corporation: Q4 Loss Widens Significantly, Revenue Declines
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation reported a net loss of ₹36.76 crore in Q4, widening 464% year-over-year. Revenue dropped 13% compared to the same quarter last year.

News.Title: ZEE Media Corp Reports Increased Q4 Net Loss
News.Summary: ZEE Media Corporation reported a consolidated net loss of 368 million rupees for Q4, compared to a loss of 65 million rupees in the same quarter last year. The loss has also increased from 224 million rupees in the previous quarter. Q4 revenue decreased to 1.56 billion rupees from 1.79 billion rupees year-over-year.

News.Title: Zee Media Approves $46.6 Million Foreign Currency Bond Issuance
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation has approved raising $46.6 million through the issuance of foreign currency bonds. This decision represents a significant financial move for the company, potentially aimed at expanding operations or refinancing existing debt.

News.Title: Zee Media Corporation: Board Meeting Scheduled to Consider Fundraising
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation announced a board meeting next week to consider raising funds. The company's shares were in focus during trading on Friday, April 4.

News.Title: Zee Media Shareholders Approve Increased FPI Limit and Securities Issuance
News.Summary: Shareholders of Zee Media have voted to increase the Foreign Portfolio Investment (FPI) limit to 49% and approve the issuance of securities up to Rs 400 crore. This decision indicates the company's intention to attract more foreign investment and raise additional capital for its operations.

News.Title: Zee Media Shareholders Approve Increased FPI Investment Limit and Security Issuance
News.Summary: Shareholders of Zee Media have voted to increase the Foreign Portfolio Investment (FPI) limit to 49%. Additionally, they have approved the issuance of securities up to Rs 400 crore.

News.Title: Zee Media Corporation Reports Q3 Financial Results
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation has announced its financial results for the third quarter. The company reported a consolidated net loss of 224 million rupees, which is an improvement from the 359 million rupees loss in the same quarter of the previous year. However, the company's revenue decreased to 1.6 billion rupees from 1.67 billion rupees year-over-year.

News.Title: Zee Media Corporation: Redeems NCDs Worth ₹230 Crore, Plans ₹400 Crore Fundraising
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation has fully redeemed Non-Convertible Debentures worth ₹230 crore on January 15, 2025. The company's board has approved exploring options to raise up to ₹400 crore through various financial instruments. Additionally, the board has authorized increasing the FPI shareholding limit from 24% to 49%, subject to shareholder approval.

News.Title: Zee Media Corporation to Raise Up to 4 Billion Rupees
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation has announced plans to raise funds totaling up to 4 billion rupees. This significant fundraising effort suggests the company is looking to strengthen its financial position, potentially for expansion, debt reduction, or other strategic initiatives.

News.Title: Zee Media Corporation Ltd: Board Approves ₹400 Crore Fundraising Plan
News.Summary: Zee Media's board has approved raising up to ₹400 crore through various instruments including equity shares and bonds. The company also plans to increase FPI and FII shareholding limits from 24% to 49%. Q2 FY2024 saw a widened net loss of ₹49.86 crore and a 13.78% drop in revenue to ₹130.70 crore.

News.Title: Zee Media Corporation to Raise Funds Up to 4 Billion Rupees
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation has announced plans to raise funds up to 4 billion rupees. This fundraising initiative suggests the company is seeking capital for potential expansion, debt reduction, or other strategic purposes. The specific use of the funds and the method of fundraising have not been detailed in the provided news snippet.

News.Title: Zee Media Corporation to Consider Fundraising Options
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation has announced a board meeting scheduled for January 13 to discuss potential fundraising through equity or convertible securities. This decision indicates the company's intention to explore various financial options to support its operations or future plans.

News.Title: Zee Media Corporation Reports Q2 Revenue Decline
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation has reported a revenue of 1.3 billion rupees for the second quarter, down from 1.5 billion rupees in the same quarter last year, representing a year-over-year decline.

News.Title: Zee Media Corporation Reports Increased Q2 Losses
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation has reported a consolidated net loss of 499 million rupees for the second quarter, compared to a loss of 307 million rupees in the same period last year. This represents an increase in losses year-over-year. Additionally, the loss has widened from 104 million rupees in the previous quarter.

News.Title: Zee Media Corporation: Shares Surge 5% on Q1 Profit and Strategic Investments
News.Summary: Zee Media Corporation Limited (ZMCL) shares rose 5% to Rs 22.40. The company reported a Q1FY25 net profit of Rs 118 crore, up from a loss in the previous year. ZMCL made a strategic investment in Flutrr Digimate Private Limited and approved the issuance of convertible warrants worth Rs 200 crore. Foreign Institutional Investors have shown increased interest in the company.

News.Title: Zee Media Corporation's Unit Invests in Flutrr Digimate
News.Summary: A subsidiary of Zee Media Corporation has entered into an agreement to invest 37.5 million rupees in Flutrr Digimate, a digital media company.

News.Title: Zee Media: ₹200 Crore Warrant Issue Approved, Stock Soars
News.Summary: Zee Media's board approves issuance of 13.33 crore warrants at ₹15 each to raise ₹200 crore. Warrants convertible to equity shares within 18 months. Three foreign portfolio investors to acquire warrants. EGM scheduled for October 22, 2024, for shareholder approval.
